data.title: List of Voice Actor Cast - Attack on Titan / Attack on Titan / Anime - Otapedia
data.meta_description: In the [*Attack on Titan*](/otapedia/anime/attack_on_titan/) animation series that is based on the original Attack on Titan manga written and illustrated by Haj...
data.text:
In the Attack on Titan animation series that is based on the original Attack on Titan manga written and illustrated by Hajime Isayama, many of the characters are voiced by popular and seasoned Japanese voice actors. Here is a list and brief description of some of the main voice actors and actresses from the anime series, including a list of filmography for the entire cast.

Yuki Kaji (Eren Jaeger)

Yuki Kaji voiced Eren Jaeger in the anime series. He was born on September 3, 1984 in Tokyo, Japan and has been actively working as a voice actor since 2004. Apart from voice acting, he is also an established singer affiliated with the agency VIMS. In addition to the role of Eren, he has also had a number of other notable roles, such as Konekomaru Miwa in Demon Slayer, Haruyuki Aria in Black Butler, Yukine in One Punch Man or Kanato Sakamaki in Fairy Tail.

Yui Ishikawa (Mikasa Ackermann)

Yui Ishikawa voiced Mikasa Ackermann in the anime series. Ishikawa was born in Hyogo Prefecture, Japan on May 30, 1989. In addition to Mikasa, she has also played other notable animation characters such as China Kousaka in Gundam Build Fighters, Sayuri Haruni in Bonjour Sweet Love Patisserie, Hinaki Shinjo in Aikatsu and YoRHa No. 2 Type B (2B) in Nier: Automata.

Marina Inoue (Armin Arlelt)

Marina Inoue voiced Armin Arlelt and the Narrator of the anime series. Inoue was born in Tokyo, Japan on January 20, 1985. Along with her voice actor career, she is also a singer affiliated with Sigma Seven. In addition to the role of Armin, she has also voiced other notable characters such as Yoko Littner in Gurren Lagann, Sodachi Oikura in Owarimonogatari and Yozora Mikazuki in Haganai.

Hiroshi Kamiya (Levi Ackermann

Hiroshi Kamiya voiced Levi Ackermann in the anime series. He was born in Chiba Prefecture, Japan on January 28, 1975. He is also a singer and a narrator affiliated with Aoni Production. He is best known for the voice of Choromatsu Matsuno in Osomatsu-san, Akashi Seijuro in Kuroko’s Basketball, Mephisto Pheles in Blue Exorcist or Trafalgar Law in One Piece.

Kishou Taniyama (Jean Kirstein)

Kishou Taniyama voiced Jean Kirstein in the anime series. He is also a singer and lyricist affiliated with Ken Production. In addition to this, he is the vocalist and lyricist of the Japanese rock band Granrodeo under his stage name Kishow. He has played the role of a number of significant characters during his voice actor career, for example he is the official Japanese dubbing voice for Fred Jones in the Scooby-Doo franchise.

Daisuke Ono (Erwin Smith)

Daisuke Ono voiced Erwin Smith in the anime series. He was born in Kochi Prefecture, Japan on May 4, 1978. He is an acclaimed Japanese voice actor and singer who has received the Best Lead Actor award in the 4th annual Seiyuu Awards for his role as Sebastian Michaelis in Black Butler, Jotaro Kujo in Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure and Shukuro Tsukishima in Bleach, as well as “Best Personalities” at the 9th Seiyuu Awards.

Yoshimasa Hosoya

Yoshimasa Hosoya voiced Reiner Braun in the anime series. He was born on February 10, 1982 in Hiroshima Prefecture, Japan. He is a Japanese voice actor and singer. In addition to the dubbing of Reiner, some of his most remarkable voice acting roles include Junpei Hyuga in Kuroko no Basuke, Nezumi in No. 6 and Asahi Azumane in Haikyuu!!. Also, he has been awarded, along with Ken’ichi Suzumara, with the “Best Actor” award in the 10th Seiyu Awards ceremony. On April 2017, he announced through his radio programm Tensai Gunshi that he would take a short break as a voice actor due to problems with his throat. He restarted his voice acting activities in August 2017, which also was announced in Tensai Gunshi.

Here is the full voice actor cast of the Attack on Titan anime series to date.
